subject: Real Estate
title: Rent Controls After Crises
description: A quick, practical guide to Rent Controls After Crises.

hook.text: After every housing crisis, politicians propose rent controls. Economists almost universally oppose them.

buildup.text: Rent controls cap how much landlords can charge, providing immediate relief to current tenants.

discovery.text: But capped rents discourage new construction. Why build if you can't charge market rates?

twist.text: Studies show rent-controlled cities see less new supply, pushing prices higher for everyone else.

climax.text: Rent control helps today's tenants at the expense of tomorrow's. It treats the symptom, not the cause.

punchline.text: Rent control helps some tenants today by hurting all tenants tomorrow.

quiz.question: What is economists' main criticism of rent control?
